definitions.definition: Having the property that, for any two distinct elements of S , at least one is not related to the other via R ; equivalently , having the property that, for any x, y ∈ S , if both xRy and yRx then x = y .
labels: of a binary relation R on a set S
definitions.label_groups: set theory , order theory , of a binary relation R on a set S

definitions.definition: Whose sign changes on the application of a matrix transpose or some generalisation thereof:

subdefinitions.definition: Whose transpose equals its negative (i.e., M = − M );
That changes sign when any two indices are interchanged (e.g., T ijk = - T jik );
For which B ( w,v ) = - B ( v,w ).

definitions.label_groups: linear algebra , of certain mathematical objects

main_definition: ( set theory , order theory , of a binary relation R on a set S ) Having the property that, for any two distinct elements of S , at least one is not related to the other via R ; equivalently , having the property that, for any x, y ∈ S , if both xRy and yRx then x = y .
secondary_definitions: ( linear algebra , of certain mathematical objects ) Whose sign changes on the application of a matrix transpose or some generalisation thereof:
